revised_title: Vegetation and Soil Observations in Eastern Mato Grosso, Brazil
tldr: The authors studied the vegetation and soil types of the Morro de Fumaça, a hill in eastern Mato Grosso, Brazil. They found a variety of vegetation types, including deciduous forest, mesotrophic facies cerradao, and open cerrado, and analyzed the soil properties associated with each. The study provides valuable information on the increasingly endangered deciduous forests of Brazil.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Soil and Vegetation Analysis
